intro: Hieracium caniphyllum, commonly known as the slender hawkweed, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, characterized by its composite flower heads made up of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 10–30 cm, with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, producing achenes as its reproductive structures. Hieracium caniphyllum is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed soils, thriving in temperate climates.
